column2:
Liability Waiver 

Participant Consent + Liability Waiver
Thank you for taking part in our study exploringJe how sound and breathwork may affect the body. This form explains your rights, responsibilities, and how we will use your information. Please read carefully and ask questions if anything is unclear.
1. Purpose of the Study
This study uses wearable devices (Apple Watch, Oura Ring, WHOOP, etc.) to collect biometric data such as heart rate, heart rate variability, activity levels, and sleep patterns. The goal is to explore how practices like breathwork and sound affect well-being.
2. Voluntary Participation
Your participation is completely voluntary.
You may stop at any time, for any reason.
If you withdraw, your data will be removed if you request it.
3. Risks + Responsibilities
Breathwork and movement may sometimes feel strenuous, emotional, or uncomfortable.
You are responsible for practicing safely, listening to your body, and stopping if you feel unwell.
Please consult your physician before participating, especially if you have any medical conditions (e.g., heart conditions, asthma, high blood pressure, pregnancy, seizures, recent injuries).
This study does not replace medical care or treatment. Facilitators are not medical doctors.
4. Data Collection + Privacy
Your device may record biometric data (heart rate, HRV, activity, sleep, oxygenation).
Your name and personal identifiers will never be attached to this data.
Reports or publications will use anonymous or aggregated results only (e.g., “average heart rate decreased after the session”).
Data will be stored securely and accessed only by authorized study members.
Your data will never be sold or shared outside this study.
5. Media (Optional)
We may take photos, video, or audio during the study.
These may be used for educational or promotional purposes.
You may choose not to be photographed/filmed—just let us know in advance.
6. Acknowledgement of Risk + Release of Liability
By participating, you acknowledge that:
There are risks inherent in physical and emotional practices.
You assume full responsibility for your participation.
You waive any claims against the facilitators, instructors, Horizon House LLC, or associated organizations for injuries or damages arising from participation.
7. Consent Statement
I confirm that:
I am at least 18 years old.
I have read and understood this document.
I voluntarily agree to participate in the Sound & Breath Biometric Study.

column172: -since the study is unblinded anyway, share the research hypothesis with participants; -1:1 interpret individual and group results with participants; -offer participant compensation; -control for more variables: sitting, blindfold, etc; -don’t bias participants with a presentation before the experiment
column173: I appreciate the endeavor to quantify qualitative experiences and the impacts of art/music therapy! Next time, if the survey could be multiple, separate surveys, that would be easier to fill out.

column171: The rising spotlight on energy, vibration, resonance, music, art & joy & the technology finally able to quantify their impact.
column172: Can’t think of a thing that I would change.
column173: Grateful to be here ~ in an age where technology expands awareness & energy, music, breath, meditation & joy guide us back to our shared connection.

column171: The live violin was extraordinary. I also really liked the meditations where we focused on the energy of the heart.
column172: Maybe start a little later so you have time to properly prep and participants don’t have to show up so early. A communal lunch would be nice too as I have the energy of the room building but it scattered a bit at lunch.

column2: I have read and understood this waiver of liability and data consent. I acknowledge that participation is voluntary, I may withdraw at any time, and I consent to the use of my anonymized biometric data for research purposes.
column171: I really enjoyed the correlations between the universe, and our own neuro make up. I’m fascinated to continue exploring what Studies can be done around Intercultural neural residence, as well as inter practice or in George spiritual.
column172: I’d really like to see and be a part of studies around melanated individuals working in dominantly none Melanated spaces and to track the heart rate of the individual who is the minority.  I’d like to emphasize this as a metaphor for the micro macro correlation.   I’d also like to do series of Studies around pre-conceived, stigma around Plant Medicine, and how that effects the ability of the individuals with pre conceived stigmas to receive the benefits in a shared space. For example, if someone thought that someone else in the space was going to tempt them out of their sobriety with , does it effect their ability to find cohesion.   How does visual representation effect heart rate in wellness spaces   brain mapping and the tests of black students flowing around other black students verse flowing with non black   How does hip hop and yoga effect the brain in correlation
column173: All and all this was amazing experience and extremely great for it for it. Thank you so much.

column171: Realizing how seamlessly your work integrates music, embodiment, and technology, and how aligned that is with several of my own creative projects.
column172: The day was extremely well designed. One idea for future studies would be exploring additional sensory inputs (like scent or taste) to deepen the embodied, emotional dimension of the experience.
column173: A beautifully integrated and inspiring experience. I felt supported, engaged, and genuinely moved. Thank you for hosting something so unique and meaningful.
